Milt,

Quote: Mito Shiiremono was just for *study's sake*.

I didn't know if Torigoye had much on the
Nagoya/Yokohama shiiremono, so I just mentioned the
Mito shiiremono. Does the Nihonto Koza Kodogu volume
have much on the Nagoya shiiremono.
   As far as I'm concerned, same difference. But
concerning Elliott's tsuba- Nagoya/Yokohama is
probably more correct.

Mass produced is mass produced.

Curran




--- bungotakadasword <MuramasaIII@...> wrote:

> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Curran Campbell
> 
> <neobliviscar@...> wrote:

> > Elliott,
> >

> > The bad:
> > Photos #19 & #20 are of a shiiremono (mass
> produced)
> > tsuba. It might even be one of the better modern
> > chinese repros. For study's sake, look up Mito
> > Shiiremono.
> >
> 
> Looks more like Nagoya/Yokohama dock side specials.
> Does not look like Mito school to me.
> 
> Since no " big money " changed hands.......... it's
> one of those " 
> what not to wear " kind of thingie, good as a
> reminder when 
> imagination runs wild.
> 
> 
> I have one " soft metal " dragon in the cloud tsuba
> with fine nanako, 
> very high relief carving of the dragon . From the
> pics it looks good 
> ( after two glasses of Yellow Tail ) but in hand it
> just gives out " 
> bad vibs " like Three Miles Island.
> 
> Milt
